name: User Datagram Protocol
summary: A connectionless transport protocol in the Internet protocol suite that allows applications to send messages without establishing a prior connection. Provides minimal transport service with no guarantees of delivery, order, or duplicate protection.
purpose: Provide a simple, low-overhead, connectionless method for sending messages between applications on a network

handshake.description: UDP is connectionless and does not perform a handshake. Data is sent directly from sender to receiver without establishing a session.

fields.name: Source Port
fields.description: Port of the sender (optional; can be 0)

fields.name: Length
fields.description: Specifies the length of the UDP header and payload in bytes

fields.name: Checksum
fields.description: Used for error-checking of the header and payload (optional in IPv4, mandatory in IPv6)

structure.header: Source Port, Destination Port, Length, Checksum

usage: Applications that require low latency and can tolerate packet loss, such as DNS queries, VoIP, video streaming, and online gaming
pitfalls: No delivery guarantee: packets can be lost or duplicated
No ordering: messages may arrive out of sequence
No built-in congestion control or flow control
No encryption or authentication by default
